news_header: Nigeria's army chief, Lt. Gen. Taoreed Abiodun Lagbaja, has died at 56 after a period of illness, as announced by President Bola Tinubu.
news_text: Lt. Gen. Taoreed Abiodun Lagbaja, Nigeria's army chief who played a crucial role in combating Boko Haram, has passed away at the age of 56. President Bola Tinubu expressed his condolences and honored Lagbaja's contributions to the nation. Lagbaja died in Lagos after being ill for some time and had not been seen in public for nearly two months. His death comes during a critical phase in Nigeria's ongoing fight against militancy in the northeastern region. He has been replaced by Lt. Gen. Olufemi Oluyede.
